intro: Conohoria riana, commonly known as the mountain orchid, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves and strikingly colored flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas, thriving in cool and moist environments. Its roots are adapted to absorb nutrients from the thin soil of its habitat. Conohoria riana is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
